title: Teaching Typography
content:
I’m looking for a source of high quality images to use in teaching presentations that represent key touchstones along the timeline of history specifically relating to the development of letterforms and the evolution of typography. An example might include a good image of the Rosetta Stone or a sample of cuneiform or possibly a high res image from the Book of Kells. These would only be used for teaching purposes and not reprinted. Any help would be much appreciated.

Thank you in advance,  
Lance Kagey

Ravenhouse Design Practice  
1430 N Prospect  
Tacoma WA  
98406

253-861-1056

 [‹ Looking for Fat Filled 70s Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605055045/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45424 "Go to previous forum topic") [Why can't people educate themselves about ampersands? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605055045/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45277 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Lance Kagey
